json.text: What's up language learners?
I got another video for you today, and this video is all about the best websites that
I have found that are gonna be the most useful for helping you to learn languages.
And these websites are not dedicated to any certain language.
In other words, you're gonna be able to use these websites to learn any language that
you're learning.
So it's not spanish specific.
You can use most of these websites to learn any language you want.
And the first website that I wanna mention...
I actually have two honorable mentions.
The first of which is Duolingo.
Now, I've created a whole video just about Duolingo that you can watch, so I don't wanna
spend a whole lot of time talking about this website on this video, but it will be enough
just to say that Duolingo is a pretty good resource for those who are just starting to
learn a language.
And once you get to intermediate or advanced levels it can't do a whole lot for you, but
if you're just starting to learn a language, Duolingo is pretty useful.
The next honorable mention I have is Lyricstraining.com.
And if you've been watching my videos for a while, you know that one of my favorite
ways of learning languages is through music, and through learning the lyrics of music.
So lyricstraining.com is a great way to do that.
You can learn French with Celine Dion.
You can learn Spanish with Enrique Iglesias, you can learn English with The Beatles.
There's a whole bunch of languages that you can learn on here, and they have a whole bunch of genres
